Reviews.Title: “great location but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMargot
Reviews.Content: The Irish staff in this hotel are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Plenty of communal bathrooms if you don't choose en suite. The only problem is that it is a pub and is extremely noisy at weekends, however, if you get a room on the second floor at the back, the noise level is bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aduboyce
Reviews.Content: Couple running the establishment are wonderful...breakfasts are good but it is very noisey on the weekends because of the Irish Pub.

Reviews.Title: “If only they didn't have bands”
Reviews.Author: neverenough44
Reviews.Content: For the price I really think you do ok. We got the room with the ensuite, and be honest you pay $150 per night, inc breakfast, to be right in the middle of the Rocks. The rooms are run down, but they are clean and the staff are terrific. Its a really friendly place to stay. BUT. If you want to sleep before 12:30 am you can pretty well forget it. We thought we would be safe from the noise by moving from a bedroom on the street to off the street but the Saturday night band played louder. And on Saturday morning they set up the market from 3am. Having said all that, if you want a drink or a meal or you want to listen to the band without staying at the hotel, then its well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: happycamper8945
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to start with this hotel. Perhaps I could overlook the 5 toenails I found on the floor throughout our stay, the fact our beds were only made about twice during the 8 horrible days we stayed there and the pounding music until midnight, if it wasn't for the way we were treated by the staff. I am a 22 year old backpacker and had spent the year staying in $20-a-night hostels, and never have I been treated like we were here! We asked the woman in charge, Yvonne, if we could please change rooms as my bed was completely broken - she said, "Jesus! Give me a break!" sighed and showed us a different room but said "You can move now or not at all girls I can't move you again after this. She's just a baby anyway she can sleep anywhere!" So, naturally, we decided to stay where we were, and the solution was to turn the bed on it's side and I slept for the week on a mattress on the floor! Unbelievable. At the end of our stay we simply left the keys in the room and left so we didn't have to talk to her again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Irish Pub Saturday afternoon with live music, don't know about the accommodation side”
Reviews.Author: MrsRocket
Reviews.Content: Called in here again, great Irish pub @ The Rocks. Busy, live music and good pub food. Great way to spend late afternoon on a wintery Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “One word...Dump”
Reviews.Author: Claire914
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Above a pub, hunt down the bartender to check in-no front desk. LUg your bags up three floor walkup - no bellhop. No phone, no adapter, no hand towels or face towels, just two towels someone probably used to wash their car, filthy rug, dusty headboard, scuzzy, stained bedspread, T.V. From the 1980's, dirty wall. I won't go on anymore other than to say the location is great, but I was horrified we had to sleep there!

Reviews.Title: “The Mercantile in Sydney - I wish there were more hotels like this!”
Reviews.Author: Nicka6241
Reviews.Content: Travelling on your own in Australia is not easy, the reason being that very few hotels have single rooms. This means you always have to pay for a double room (or an apartment for 2 adults and 4 kids) , i.e. you pay at least twice the price all the time (unless you want to sleep in a dorm of course). One exception is the Mercantile Hotel in Sydney! I could not believe my eyes when they said they actually had a single room!! For only 80 AUS$ including breakfast! This is less than I paid anywhere else during my 3 week trip to Australia. OK, my room was very simple and the view was towards the street. And I shared bathrooms with the other hotel guests. This was not a problem, however, since there were four bathrooms and very few guests. And sometimes I had to use ear plugs because the music in the pub downstairs was too loud for me to fall asleep. But all in all, this was the best place I stayed. Nice to get back to the hotel late at night, to the pub full of people and live music. And the restaurant served great food! If I ever come to Sydney again, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great Location, But Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLady09
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of the Mercantile, but they have a nasty attitude. We arrived in the pouring rain, and we had to carry our own luggage up three flights of stairs. There is no bell boy, and the woman who checked us in did not help. When I asked her for two extra towels, she threw them on my wet backpack. When I asked her for a second luggage rack, she said, "This is not the Hilton." I had asked her nicely. The room was clean, and there is soap, but no shampoo. I asked for a quiet room, but there was alot of street noise, including some construction while we were there. There is no desk to check in, and you have to pay your bill during limited day time hours. At breakfast, we asked the cook for some tomatoes (which I saw in front of him), instead of pork. He made a sarcastic remark, but gave me the tomatoes anyway. The last morning, when we had to leave very early for the airport, I asked if we could get some cheese and rolls and juice the night before, since breakfast was included. I got a firm "no." I got another retort about, "This is not the Hilton." Overall, the room was clean, and the location great, but for $140, they really should dump the attitude, and perhaps have a full time desk for check in and luggage help.

Reviews.Title: “good value good fun and good location”
Reviews.Author: francey75
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights. room is basic but for just over $100 a night for the room in the rocks is a bargain especially at the "Rocks". you don't come to Sydney to sit in your room anyway. pub is down stairs and is good for a drink or two especially at weekends. room was serviced every day which is rare in Oz. would recommend to couples and young people who want to stay in city centre on the cheap and not in a hostel. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in name only!”
Reviews.Author: Wouldyouadamandeveit
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, a hotel in name only! The Mercantile is an Irish pub with accommodation above, so if you want a nice reception with room service & an extensive choice of breakfast, this is NOT the place for you. Instead you have to speak to someone behind the bar to book in (still using that dog eared exercise book & pencil), carry your own suitcases up the stairs (no lift) & if you do not fancy a "cooked breakfast" in the morning, I'm not sure what you do! Having said those awful things the location of The Mercantile is superb, being only 5/10 mins walk from all of Circular Quay's attractions. Staying in "The Rocks" area of Sydney is a must because everything you need starts from here. The Harbour Bridge/Opera House/Manly & Darling Harbour Ferrys/hop on - hop off tour bus/Botanical Gardens & The Rocks itself. You can even catch the train from the airport direct to Circular Quay for 15$ & takes about 15 mins. My wife & I paid 140$ for a double room with ensuite corner bath (circa 1980) & walk in shower. The room was large, had windows that you could open (3rd floor) & included a hearty cooked breakfast in the morning. An extra bonus was a small empty fridge & tea/coffee facilities topped up everyday, BUT there was no wardrobe -- just a line of hooks on the back of the door!! The biggest downside to The Mercantile is that every Fri/Sat & Sunday the road o/side(George St) is closed off to traffic & a craft market is set up. Combined with this the hotel has "live" Irish entertainment from early evening until about 11.00pm on each of these nights. So if you are looking for an early sleep -- look again! Luckily we were there from Sunday until Thursday so only had the one night experience, the rest of the week was fine. So staying at The Mercantile is certainly different & for us, once was enough. Mind you I priced The Holiday Inn just a few yards further down & it started from 200$ a day room only, so it could be said The Mercantile is good value. The Rocks area is superb, like staying in a living museum with old buildings all around as it was the original jumping off point for all those naughty travellers in days of old. As for Sydney Harbour & it's surroundings you will not be able to stop clicking away, absolutely lovely as indeed Australia is -- we did not want to leave BUT as the fridge magnets say: "Australia, it's a bloody long way mate."

Reviews.Title: “Great location but spartan room”
Reviews.Author: fieldsold
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Mercantile Hotel. The best thing about this place is the location: right in the heart of the Rocks which is the historic part of Sydney. And just one block from Sydney Harbor. From this hotel you can quickly walk to most of the Sydney highlights: the Harbor Bridge, the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens, Circular Quay with its ferry and subway stations, lots of restaurants. The Mercantile is only a few blocks from the Four Seasons, which I think costs about $300 per night, and one block from the Old Sydney Holiday Inn. But the Mercantile cost me only about $75/night U.S. and that included a full breakfast. So the location is superb. The breakfast is served until 9:30am, and included juice, toast, coffee or tea, and eggs. It was nothing to write home about, but it was okay. I did like the Irish guy who appears to run the place, and the staff are for the most part very nice and cordial. The place has a relaxed atmosphere which I liked. There is a restaurant and pub at the hotel. The restaurant serves Irish food, bangers and mash and all that. I did not eat there. So I've now mentioned all the good parts: great location, nice staff, free cooked breakfast, relaxed vibe. I also liked the antique feel of the hotel--I don't know just how old it is, but it is definitely old. And it hasn't been spiffed up lately, although that didn't bother me. For example, the carpet on the stairs was worn. So the place has character. My room could best be described as spartan. It was small, with a single bed, and small table, and an electric fan on a floor stand. And that was pretty much it. But the bed was comfortable, and there was a window that opened. I did love the great tin ceiling and crown moulding. I chose the cheaper room which comes with shared bath. There were 4 large bathrooms in a row right next to my room, and at any one time at least several of them were available. They were very clean, and everything worked fine. One potential problem at this hotel could be the noise from the pub. I asked to stay in a room on the back of the hotel (as I had read the reviews about noise), and I was given a back room on the third floor. My first night was a Thursday, and there was virtually no noise. The second night was a Friday, and the pub was a-rockin' and there was lots of noise, even though I was on the third floor and in the back. But I just turned on the fan in my room, and the white noise from the slightly noisy fan drowned out enough of the music noise to allow me to sleep just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: TMJE98033
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Mercantile reminded me of solo travels through Ireland years ago -- scent of stale beer in the air, modest room, decent price, great location. The owners get bonus points for modern clean shared bathrooms on the hall. All in all, a fine pick for budget accommodations if you're not planning to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevo64
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Mercantile for the past 12 years and have found it to be an enjoyable and always a comfortable stay.We always come down there every year from the Gold coast and we stay for 3 days for the rugby bledisloe cup.The staff and food are great and we dont worry about the noise.Looking forward to being there in September again for another awesome 3 days. Steve.S

Reviews.Title: “great location, but could use some tlc”
Reviews.Author: brooksdj7
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky person... the location and price of this hotel make it awesome as well as the free breakfast thrown in. With the location and how it is in the Rocks the place is a great deal. The honest truth is that the hotel could use some touch ups.. its as simple as a little paint, a new comforter, and some small touches. The place has a lot of character with really cool crown molding and painted tin ceilings and you could tell there was history there. They only gave us soap and no shampoo which I found to be a little weird. Also there is no sort of front desk u simply walk to bar and tell them you are staying in the hotel...you square the details up in a small converted office upstairs and go to your room. Also beware if you are picky, the hallways to the rooms do smell of beer. This didn't really bother us but again this place is a great deal and location... just has some issues. Glad we stayed but I don't think this place would work for everyone. If you are looking to stay in the rocks and not spend a ton probably the best for the money if your not planning on spending a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Friendly Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OldChris
Reviews.Content: Great value and as we had a room at the back on the top floor(3rd) didn't suffer the noise that some reviewers have talked about but this is a working pub with live music every night.The decor was dated and a little threadbear but CLEAN with comfortable bed. The ensuite had a seperate shower and bath with plenty of hot water. Staff were very helpfull and friendly. There is a lock up room to store your luggage on the last day. Good mix of tourists and locals in the bar at night. The whole place reminded me very much of OSheas Talbot Street Dublin!!!! The only possible down side is there are no lifts so a bit of a struggle getting the luggage up to the room but again on leaving a staff member took the wifes bags down.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: tj04
Reviews.Content: Great location just steps away from the Sydney harbor bridge, opera house, & Circular Quay. Reminded me of European hotels. It's above an Irish pub & the room rate includes a full Irish breakfast. They serve pub food the rest of the day - it's a bit over priced, but good. Take the train from the airport to Circular Quay & save the cab fare. Quick five minute walk from the train station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kez76
Reviews.Content: this place is buzzing full of friendly staff all wanting to know where youve been and where youre going on to. i felt really at home. Superb Breakfast on a morning and the guy who serves you it is such a nice Irish man. I cant fault my room - absolutely massive and the bath was a big corner bath. I saw one report on here before i left about cockroaches and it being dirty and not to eat here. Rubbish!!! its clean, cockroaches are a regular thing in sydney on the streets anyway so if windows and doors are open they get in - they got in my room because i left the window open. its a fab place to stay your right in the thick of it and its very well priced - thouroughly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice place indeed!”
Reviews.Author: crislondon08
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the hotel (first one on february 2008) and it's a great value for a perfect location.I did a good reserch and you cannot find anything else so cheap and so nice in The Rock. People are friendly, breakfast very good, rooms and bath huge and you can avoid noises by getting a room at the back and on high floors.Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon-Lucy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated in Sydney 'The Rocks', about 5 mins from the Opera House and right by the Sydney Bridge. We could see the Sydney Bridge Climbers starting their climb from our bathroom window. The Rocks Market is held every weekend literally right outside the hotel. The hotel is above an Irish pub where you get a lovely cooked breakfast every morning all included. Felt very safe, very reasonably priced and lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Irish Hotel & Bar!”
Reviews.Author: nip09
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel in a great location. It's irish themed and run, so laid back is the order of the day. The rooms are basic but clean. The owners hands are tied regarding improvements to windows etc, due to stringent regulations covering listed buildings in the area. Therefore you can expect a little noise from the outside market on weekend mornings. The friendliness of the staff and management more than make up for a little noise! The food served is excellent and reasonably priced, and overall, I found the Mercantile great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central non expensive place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Solovetravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in October 2008 with 3 girl friends. The hotel has a great location in Sydney, clean, comfortable and for a no frills very reasonably priced stay it is great. Lovely breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to explore a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: tinterwebtim
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in Melbourne, my wife and I took a short break up to Sydney to take in the sights, The Mercantile was booked for us and we loved it. Its location in The Rocks gives wonderful access to Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens. We had a double room with an ensuite bathroom with an enormous bath and it was clean and comfortable. The AC handled what we were assured was unseasonally hot weather (HOT!!) and the helpful and friendly staff made the stay very relaxed. Other reviewers have made mention of the noise here, and given its location and the large bar on the premises I can see that it may be a problem, however I can honestly say that I did not notice anything and had the best nights sleep of the entire holiday. (Although that might be down to the fact the the children were still in Melbourne...) Would I go back? Yes. Again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The great location comes with some noise”
Reviews.Author: ntai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated within a short walking distance of the Sydney Harbor Bridge and Circular Quay. We got a room with shared bathroom and both were very clean and comfortable. The best part was the huge brekkie served up in the morning with juice or a huge cup of coffee. The trade off is that it is located right on top of a pub which got loud at night but usually calmed down latest by 1am. Try to get a room on the 3rd floor and, if possible, not facing the street because the George Street market sets up early Saturday morning and woke us up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: scooter4000
Reviews.Content: Mercantile Hotel is in a fantastic location in the beautiful Rocks area of Sydney - walking distance to Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour Bridge. However, when you stay there, ask for a room that doesn't face on to George St - I am sure it will be a lot quieter. We stayed there for a Thursday and Friday night, in a double room with private bathroom, that faced onto George St. Although after seeing the accommodation, I also woud have been quite happy staying in a room with shared bathroom - the bathrooms were very clean and I don't think you would have ever had to wait to use them. The room itself was great, very clean, as was our bathroom. Breakfast was also great. Thursday night we heard alot of traffic noise from the street below - it didn't keep us awake or anything but we were just aware of it all night (I think the windows are quite thin and don't block out much street noise). In the early hours of Saturday morning, we heard kegs being rolled down the street (very, very loud) and shortly after that, what sounded like construction noise, which turned out to be people setting up the markets on the street below (also very loud!) Being above a pub wasn't a problem, we didn't hear any noise from the patrons or band. All in all, the location and value for money makes up for any sleep disturbances - just pack your earplugs or better still, get a room that doesn't face onto George St.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Living_in_Hotels
Reviews.Content: Ok the location is excellent (right in the middle of the rocks) but the rest is terrible. I amazed by the other reviews and wondered if they have not been written by the hotel owners. I don't think we can call it an hotel as it is more a bed and breakfast. There's no reception or permanent services. It is very noisy, especially on weekends as the pub is crowded and with live musis bands playing (until 1am, later on weekends). There's a mixed smell of beer and old socks The noise insulation from windows is almost inexistant so you get all the noises from the street (traffic, people shouting). There's no room cleaning service between days and the cleaniness is average. Be careful, the checkout time is early (10:30am). So finally I think this hotel is good for party animals or people who don't mind noise or sleeping less but want to be nicely located at a reasonable price. The staff is nice except the breakfast cook who is sometime not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rat68
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great. Close to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Harbour bridge and transport. Breakfast was terrific and plenty of it. We ate at the pub a couple of times and the meals arrived quickly and the serving sizes were ample. We stayed in a room with our own spa in the ensuite. The shower alcove was a mouldy, but the rest of the bathroom was fine. The room decor was bland. The size of the rooms were larger than a motel room. The stairs were steep and narrow , especially where your foot is placed, so this can be a bit scary if you are wearing high heels. It was noisy in the morning on the weekends, due to the market. The music downstairs was great, unless you wanted to sleep, but they did finish at a reasonable time. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: albatrossy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for part of my two week visit to Sydney. It is a great location by the bridge and perfect for public transportation as it is a quick walk to Circular Quay buses and ferries. There are lots of shops, restaurants, museum nearby including a very helpful visitor information center. They still use actual keys (not magnetic cards) and they book the room in a paper ledger! My room had sizeable bathroom with a big spa tub and a large shower. Thank goodness the maid left her spray cleaner because the shower was VERY moldy. I was satisfied after I cleaned it myself. The furniture was very basic (again I had to dust off a couple of pieces) and I had no phone, but I did have a small refrigerator and an electric kettle with plenty of coffee. There was loud music on the weekend and they set up the market EARLY on Saturday morning--lots of banging just outside my room. Lucky I was planning to get up early anyway. The breakfast was good and had some surprises (black pudding, which I love) but apparently you can't order, you just take what they bring you. All in all, I'd probably stay again because of the location, price (breakfast included) and the convenience of the room. If it had been well cleaned I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: JBYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercantile for three nights in July. I had a single room with an ensuite, both were large and clean. The shower was fantastic. I found the staff incredibly friendly and they made a single traveller feel very much at home. And the included breakfast, well it kept me going well into the afternoon. Only down side, if you can call it one, is that they have live music every night, but this did stop at 11.45pm at the latest (i was there during the week). Finally the location is just perfect, you are virtually under Harbor bridge, in the centre of the rocks and Opera House is just a 5 min walk around the other side of the Circular Key. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, who wants a small friendly hotel rather than a large multi national.
